Title: Senior Product Manager, Promotions & Pricing
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy and Salary: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
The salary range for this position is $161,000 - $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
Who We Are
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our Product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with Engineering, Analytics, Design, and business leaders across Wayfair, our Product team ensures were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways.
Were tackling a wide array of fascinating, incredibly difficult problems  like helping a massive, rapidly growing global customer base efficiently find the perfect products from our catalog of >10M items. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing and personalization. And were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety and intentional career development.
The Promotions & Pricing team owns the platform and front-end experiences that power Wayfairs promotional events & on-site pricing experience. We are responsible for building the tools, services and customer-facing features that make events like Way Day, Black Friday/Cyber Monday, and monthly sale events possible. Our mission is to create scalable platforms that empower internal stakeholders to run world-class promotions while ensuring our customers enjoy compelling, intuitive, and value-driven shopping experiences.
What Youll Do

Define & Drive Roadmaps: Partner closely with business stakeholders to create roadmaps that balance platform scalability with delightful customer experiences.
Build for Both Internal Users & Our Customers: Translate the needs of both Wayfair customers and internal teams into requirements that improve workflows & on-site experiences.
Product Requirements & Delivery: Author PRDs & collaborate with design and engineering to deliver new features, enhancements, and platform capabilities that support promotions & pricing.
Own Promotion & Offer Enablement: Support & optimize the tools, systems and processes that enable Wayfairs biggest promotional events, ensuring reliable execution by the business and continuous improvement.
Data-Driven Problem Solving: Leverage qualitative & quantitative insights to identify opportunities, break down complex problems, and measure the impact of product initiatives.
Full-Stack Product Leadership: Operate across platform & front-end product domains  from backend systems that power promotions to customer-facing experiences that drive engagement.
Cross-Functional Leadership: Work with engineering, design, analytics, and commercial partners to align on priorities, deliver results, and advocate for the promotions & pricing experience within the broader Wayfair ecosystem.

Were A Match Because You Have

6+ years of product management experience, ideally in e-commerce or platform products.
Proven track record of building & scaling impactful platform & customer-facing products.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to use data (SQL, Looker, BigQuery) to drive decisions.
Experience balancing backend platform development with intuitive front-end experiences.
Familiarity with A/B testing, experimentation, and agile development practices.
Excellent communication & stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence cross-functional teams & business leadership, and translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Customer-first mindset & empathy for both customers & internal stakeholders.
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field (advanced degree preferred).

Who We Are
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product design team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product design team ensures that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. Were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.
As a Product Designer II, you will be part of our Supply Chain Retail Technology organization, transforming complex operational challenges into simple, efficient, and scalable design solutions that improve our daily operations. Your work will ensure that products are available in the right places, at the right time, with the right cost and quality, enabling seamless delivery experiences for our customers while creating differentiated value for our suppliers and carriers. Within our Experience Design team, youll help drive cross-functional collaboration, usability, efficiency, safety, scalability, and cost optimization across the entire supply chain, from forecasting and inventory management to home delivery and post-delivery services.

Utilize design thinking principles to build engaging user experiences which solve complex problems with simplicity.
Collaborate with product managers, developers, and other experienced designers to execute design concepts that deliver on brand goals, business goals, and are technically feasible to implement.
Align with multiple teams to create cross-functional and user-centric design solutions.
Drive a sense of urgency in the team to deliver work, emphasizing the use of lean tools and techniques to more rapidly deliver work.

Contribute to the improvement of our cross-team collaboration Design processes, advocating best practices and innovative solutions between Product, Design, and Engineering teams embracing Agile methodologies.

 We Are a Match Because You Have:

3+ years of professional UX experience.
The ability to deliver high-fidelity design work and user validation autonomously.
Strong understanding of design processes; knowledge of what is possible and what will be hard to achieve and/or implement in a digital environment.

Strong skills in modern design tools like Figma, Miro, UserTesting and Google Workplace.
An online portfolio of case studies that demonstrates unfailing advocacy for the user, highlighting: e-commerce design work, enterprise design work, data-driven approaches, and strategic thinking.

Title: Data Scientist III, Customer Technology - Fintech & Loyalty
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $172,180 - $185,424 CAD per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
This is a hybrid role based out of our Toronto, Ontario office (Tuesday - Thursday Onsite, Monday / Friday remote)
Who We Are
Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Customer Technology team builds and scales the platforms that enable Wayfair to deliver exceptional customer experiences across storefront, service, and financial products. Within this Customer technology organization, the Fintech & Loyalty team ensures customers have a seamless and rewarding journey by powering payments, financing, and loyalty programs.
The Fintech & Loyalty Data Science team aims to unlock & enable high quality product insights and develop innovative data products. We collaborate with Product, Engineering, Finance, Commercial and various external partners across diverse payments and financial products to improve and evolve our customers' purchase experiences. 
As a Data Scientist III for Customer Tech, your goal is to unlock insights and guide the business in the data domain. This includes everything from advising on technical implementation tradeoffs and priorities (e.g. funnel efficiencies, loyalty & card program growth etc.) to developing broad level strategic direction and vision in our customer data strategy and architecting the future data models to meet our users needs and anticipating impactful use cases. All while maintaining data quality and analytical rigor. To be successful, this role requires a blend of analytical experience, strong technical capability, ability to develop and influence business strategy, and stakeholder management; all applied to drive the quality, impactfulness, and vision of  Wayfairs customer data. 
What You'll Do

Define and own the strategic agenda to unlock insights and guide the business
Run open-ended exploratory data analysis to identify new ideas and opportunities
Champion the use of generative AI tools to accelerate analysis, automate repetitive tasks, and enhance insight generation.
Design and drive A/B tests of our latest technology being implemented ( e.g., new financing offers, rewards features, or personalized incentives) to ensure effective and accurate data capture for experimentation reporting
Own P&L reporting for Fintech & Loyalty programs, ensuring accurate tracking of financial performance and key metrics.
Proactively monitor our data to identify potential issues, determine root causes, and resolve. 
Build new tools and pipelines that allow us to be more productive and efficient.
Work closely and build productive relationships with our product, engineering,finance, commercial and machine learning stakeholders.
Proactively identify areas where advanced analytical efforts can produce a strong value add and work them into the road map.
Communicate key insights and recommendations to cross-functional executive leaders across the organization

What You'll Need

Bachelors in computer science, engineering, math, statistics, economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
4+ years work experience in a relevant field (in addition to any graduate education).
Analytics or Data Science experience with e-commerce or fintech companies is a strong plus.
In-depth experience with SQL (aggregate functions, query optimization, stored procedures, string parsing, GBQ/Spark, etc.), required.
In-depth experience with python & python tools (Jupyter notebooks, functions, pandas, sklearn, matplotlib, etc.), required.
Experience with experimental design (A/B tests) and statistical analysis to drive business decision making.
Experience with Looker (or similar BI tools) for reporting and dashboarding.
Knowledge and experience using machine learning algorithms/techniques (decision trees, random forest, deep learning, etc.) within a business context, highly preferred. 
Strong written and verbal communication with a team player, highly collaborative attitude. 
Ability to collaborate and proactively communicate with stakeholders.
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Thrive in a fast-paced environment. 
Strong business acumen, analytical skills, and technical abilities along with problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated success influencing senior level stakeholders on strategic direction based on recommendations backed by in-depth analysis.
Prior experience proactively identifying areas where analytical efforts can produce a strong business value add and setting the analytics roadmap.
Able to manage multiple projects and deliver against aggressive goals.

RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy and Salary: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.

The salary range for this position is $126,500 - $137,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.

Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. Were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.
We are seeking an innovative, entrepreneurial and technical product leader to join the Growth Customer Experience product team. This role is pivotal in shaping how we differentiate Wayfair with inspiration-first discovery experiences, engaging customers visiting from various marketing journeys and creating helpful home project-oriented experiences. You will have the opportunity to leverage cutting-edge AI and personalization technologies to craft a best-in-class user experience, guiding customers on a seamless journey from the moment they land on our site. This role requires a candidate with a comprehensive understanding of complex, cross-functional systems across multiple domains and a passion for creating data-driven, personalized experiences. You will not only oversee the implementation of the product roadmap, but define the long-term strategy for how we introduce customers to our site, ensuring a unique and tailored experience for every individual.
 What Youll Do:

Use data to understand customer needs and behaviors; map those against business objectives, and transform that knowledge into AI-powered product enhancements
Build client agnostic backends that solve for the needs of customers across all of our platforms: iOS and Android apps, mobile web and desktop applications
Given a broad and complex product strategy, independently own and craft a sequenced set of outcomes and solutions over a 12+ month time horizon
Build and maintain roadmaps for your product(s); partner with user experience design and usability, analytics, engineering, technical program managers, other product managers, and stakeholders to translate your vision and roadmap into reality  
Drive measurable results and/or learnings using testing best practices; monitor performance of your focus area 

We Are A Match Because You Have: 

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
3+ years experience working in product management. Experience in ecommerce, and at companies that own a significant tech stack highly valued.

The Category Ops Project Specialist is responsible for driving operational excellence across the full project lifecycle within their given category - from category opportunity vetting to end to end opportunity management. This involves managed sales and B2B category stakeholder management coordination, customer and post-order communication, as well as order execution. This role acts as the central Account Management and Enterprise large project category owner - ensuring seamless handoffs, project deliverable alignment, resolving roadblocks, and facilitating clear communication to achieve successful project outcomes. In addition to project management, the category specialists will execute against sales capabilities and order placement, as the subject matter experts of the category. 
Key Responsibilities:

Opportunity Vetting

Gather key deliverable, product, and logistics details - including project scope, timelines, and delivery requirements.
Determine feasibility and next steps for customer engagement. 
Request additional insight and specs on the category project directly with the customer, providing visibility to the managed sales partner engagement.

End to End Opportunity Management & Project Prioritization

Partner with managed field sales teams to communicate with customers on project needs and budget, ensuring inclusion in the opportunity submission. 
Evaluate and prioritize projects based on potential value, partner lead times on deliverables, and customer deadline for completion.
Maintain visibility into the project pipeline to support proactive planning.
Align internal stakeholders and resources for execution, driving a timeline for completion forward.

Stakeholder & Customer Communication Strategy

Coordinate across relevant PSG team members to ensure smooth workflows and completion of the project in a timely manner. 
Act as the communication bridge between managed sales teams and Large Project team members to be the single source of truth for project needs.
Track and document opportunity timeline and needs to reduce friction and improve efficiency.
Drive key supplier negotiations and issue resolution by effectively partnering with sales ops on execution.
Coordinate with B2B category management stakeholders to ensure close alignment on category pricing strategy, product selection, and inventory positioning. 

Project Roadblock Escalation & Resolution

Identify and address risks or delays across the project lifecycle.
Escalate issues to relevant stakeholders and proactively provide recommended solutions to managed sales teams. 
Drive accountability and follow-up on open items until resolution, prior to order placement to project installation.

Order Execution & Procurement

Source and procure products for a category project, ensuring availability, quality, and alignment with project needs.
Place and track category-specific orders accurately and on time to support the project timeline.
Own category relevant project quoting, including bulk requests and tag items per room location. 
Manage SKU reselects and substitute out-of-stock items efficiently to avoid project delays and maintain the initial order integrity.

Post-Order Project Completion

Maintain visibility into final delivery, installation, and possible project delays - coordinating with the customer on their timing and managing the customers specific needs.  
Coordinate post-order support between the Service and the Large Project delivery/installation team, effectively facilitating next steps to complete the project.

As Associate Director, you will lead a growing team of 20+ and serve as the primary owner of strategic inventory and fulfillment partnerships with our Asia-based suppliers. Key responsibilities include:

Driving adoption and expansion of CastleGate, Wayfairs proprietary warehousing and fulfillment solution, for both Wayfair and third-party retail orders

Serving as an internal thought partner and leader on how our CastleGate offering should evolve over time

Serving as a trusted advisor and COO thought partner to our top-tier suppliers, ensuring high-performance inventory management through operational excellence and data-driven strategies
Leading and developing a team of supply chain professionals across analytics, vendor management, and operations

This role is critical to enabling scale, growth, and supply chain excellence across Wayfairs global network.

Leadership & Strategy

Lead and mentor a 20+-person team across inventory planning, operational strategy and performance, and supplier development
Set strategic direction and priorities for supplier inventory and fulfillment operations across Asia
Serve as the voice for current and future imperatives for our Asia-based suppliers; Partner with global Wayfair leaders in Category Management, Network Management, Transportation / Logistics, and more to drive supplier outcomes

Supplier Partnership & Business Development

Own supplier relationships for Asia-based vendors, acting as a COO-like partner to their business operations leads
Drive adoption and performance of CastleGate services for Wayfair and non-Wayfair channels
Influence suppliers production, supply chain, and warehousing strategies to maximize speed, availability, and cost efficiency

Inventory & Fulfillment Excellence

Ensure strong in-stock performance, inventory turns, and aged inventory health for a multi-million dollar network of SKUs
Identify and execute optimization strategies around inventory placement, allocation, and forecasting
Own supplier performance tracking and resolution of operational risks

Data, Analytics & Execution

Title: Associate Director Product, Buy Platform
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair is seeking a senior product leader to shape and scale our global payments infrastructure and integrations. These platforms are critical for processing Wayfairs billions of dollars in annual global revenue and helping Wayfairs millions of customers shop confidently by making transactions with Wayfair secure, seamless, and convenient. 
You will partner with Wayfairs Financing, Loyalty, Payments, Fraud, and Gift Card business teams to drive product strategy, roadmaps, and delivery across a broad set of payment journeys. The Purchase technology teams also design, build, and evolve surrounding customer experiences including Cart, Checkout, Financing education & approval, Loyalty sign-up and renewals, across all web and native app platforms.
The Associate Director, Product Management will serve as the key internal product expert of Payments technology bringing deep prior experience from Payments and FinTech industries. You will drive prioritization and guide key trade-off and sequencing decisions balancing effectively for value, adoption, and scale. This leader is highly-visible with audiences from the C-Suite down. This leader will also be responsible for people management of 6+ PMs based in Bangalore, dedicated to delivering outcomes across our Purchase domains. A strong candidate is an adept strategic thinker and product operator, with proven success acting with pragmatism and hands-on involvement delivering results with their teams.
What You'll Do:

Partner with senior leaders to define and align the business and product vision for payments at Wayfair
Deliver measurable impact (e.g., improving authorization rates and reducing costs) across core payments systems including authorization, settlement, routing, and tokenization
Lead, develop, and mentor a team of 6+ Bangalore-based product managers, fostering a high-performance, customer-obsessed product culture
Partner deeply with Engineering and Data Science to build a resilient, scalable, and secure payments infrastructure supporting multiple programs and lines of business
Shape technology strategy and product roadmaps with Wayfairs 20+ global external payments vendors and partners streamlining working models, processes, and solutions 
Lead cross-functional teams in roadmapping, prioritization, and product delivery across key domains, including Cart & Checkout, Loyalty, Financing, Payments, Fraud, and Gift Cards
Drive collaboration across internal stakeholders while incorporating external industry insights to shape investment decisions and surface opportunities for innovation
Act as a key voice for Payments, providing senior stakeholders with clear, data-backed perspectives on priorities, trade-offs, and product value
Regularly monitor performance of initiatives and communicate performance metrics to key stakeholders
Leverage data to understand risks, impacts, scope and priorities of our business objectives, and enable the teams to drive results
Establish operating models and decision frameworks that accelerate execution and increase cross-functional alignment

What youll Need:

Overall 15+ years of experience and at least 8 years in product management, including significant work in Payments or FinTech at scale (UX and Platforms, strong record of success)
Proven people leadership experience with a track record of coaching, mentoring, and building high-performing product teams of 6+ PMs, particularly in distributed settings
Deep domain expertise in the Payments ecosystem, with strong hands-on understanding of authorization, routing, tokenization, and related systems
Proven tenure building and shaping external vendor partnerships 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with experience in hypothesis-driven thinking and converting data into actionable insights
Strong strategic instincts and the ability to balance long-term platform investments with immediate business needs
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to influence across domains and at all levels of the organization
Sufficient technical fluency to engage in architecture, infrastructure, and system design decisions. Able to extract and guide the necessary trade-off decisions as needed between value, scalability, and time horizon
